Each dot in the plot below is a month and is showing the percent of CVEs published in that month that had at least one complete combination of a CVSS vector string and base score published in the CVE record.












This looks at the percent of CVEs with at least one valid CVSS record from each CNA and compares against the total number of CVEs from that CNA.

title: Problem types
text: Should there always be a “lang” and “type” and “cweId” or what’s the best combination?

title: Problem types
section: Number off CWEs in CVE records
text:
Number off CWEs in CVE records
This section is aggregating any identification of CWE ID in any of the three common fields.
Note that seven CVEs had five (5) unique CWEs in a single CVE record.









CWE’s have different level of Abstractions as well as views and categories. CWE recommends only assigning “Base” CWEs to vulnerabilities.

title: Problem types
text:
top CWEs









We can get a better idea of what these are by using the “Comprehensive Categorization” in category 1400. It maps every CWE up to a one of twenty-two high-level categories.
